channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: This is BBC Four
channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Gary Wilmot Remembers... Showstoppers
channel.desc: Gary Wilmot looks back fondly on his time presenting Showstoppers, a 1995 series jam-packed with well-known hits from musical theatre.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Showstoppers
channel.desc: Gary Wilmot presents songs from stage and screen musicals. Featuring Tom Conti, Barbara Dickson and Michael Feinstein.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Showstoppers
channel.desc: Gary Wilmot presents songs from stage and screen musicals. Featuring performances by Sarah Brightman, Brian Conley and Dennis Waterman.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Anything Goes
channel.desc: Filmed live at the Barbican in London, this major production of the classic musical comedy features an all-star cast led by renowned Broadway actress Sutton Foster.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Big Night of Musicals 2024 by the National Lottery
channel.desc: Jason Manford hosts a glittering musical celebration, with spectacular performances and special guests, including Beverley Knight and Alfie Boe.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Gershwin 's Summertime
channel.desc: Song That Conquered the World. Investigation into the extraordinary life of Gershwin's classic composition, Summertime.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Wainwright
channel.desc: Documentary recalling the life of Alfred Wainwright, the eccentric Lancastrian who created a series of iconic fell-walking books in the 1950s, and his love for the Lake District.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: David Attenborough
channel.desc: Michael Palin presents a profile of the television career of David Attenborough, from controller of BBC Two to his wildlife programmes such as Life on Earth and The Blue Planet.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Attenborough and the Giant Dinosaur
channel.desc: Sir David Attenborough tells the story of the discovery in Argentina of the largest animal to ever walk the earth, a new species of the plant-eating titanosaur.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Jonathan Dimbleby
channel.desc: Broadcaster Jonathan Dimbleby reflects on his father Richard's reporting on the liberation of the Belsen concentration camp.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Richard Dimbleby at Belsen
channel.desc: In this film from 1965, broadcaster Richard Dimbleby returns to Belsen, 20 years after his first radio account of the liberation of the concentration camp.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: After the Battle
channel.desc: In the series following former war reporters as they return to past battlefields, Richard Dimbleby goes back to Germany.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Belsen
channel.desc: A documentary directed by Sam Mendes, reliving the liberation of Bergen-Belsen. Contains scenes which some viewers may find disturbing.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Quentin Blake
channel.desc: The beloved illustrator and famous fans on Roald Dahl and other artistic adventures.

channel.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power
channel.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of the village of Cromford in Derbyshire.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Wainwright Walks
channel.desc: Julia Bradbury explores the work of Britain's well-known fell walker and author Alfred Wainwright. She is in the Western Lakes to walk to the summit of the Haystacks fell.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Hidden History
channel.desc: The secrets of a lost archive of portrait photos showing the changing face of Bradford.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: Seventies sitcom about a couple who decide to become self-sufficient. Margo is horrified when she hears of Tom and Barbara's decision to keep pigs in the garden.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes, Minister
channel.desc: First episode of the acclaimed sitcom about an apparently clueless British government minister and the advisers who surround him.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: David Hockney
channel.desc: Britain's most popular living artist David Hockney talks to Katie Razzall about why painting still makes him happy at 87, ahead of the opening of his biggest-ever show.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: David Hockney
channel.desc: Documentary capturing the return from California of England's favourite living artist. As Hockney approaches the age of 70, he re-invents his painting from scratch.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Hockney
channel.desc: An intimate documentary profile of artist David Hockney as he returns to the theme of double portraits, three decades after his iconic Mr and Mrs Clark and Percy. From 2003.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Face to Face with David Hockney
channel.desc: In an interview first broadcast in 1996, artist David Hockney talks to Jeremy Isaacs about painting, designing for the opera and his growing deafness.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power
channel.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the rise, fall and rise of Lavenham in Suffolk, the best-preserved medieval village in the country.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Wainwright Walks
channel.desc: Series in which Julia Bradbury explores the work of Britain's greatest fell walker Alfred Wainwright. Julia climbs her first mountain, Blencathra, and tackles Sharp Edge.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Atlantic
channel.desc: Documentary about the Atlantic Ocean. In the North Atlantic, massive whale pods, giant turtles and monstrous jellyfish ride the Gulf Stream, a huge ocean current.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Shipwrecks
channel.desc: The story of the top-heavy Mary Rose, the wrecking of the Spanish Armada and the real-life sea disasters that inspired The Tempest and Robinson Crusoe.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Jimmy McGovern Remembers... Common
channel.desc: Writer Jimmy McGovern looks back on his 2014 drama based on the UK's controversial joint enterprise law.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Common
channel.desc: Writer Jimmy McGovern's drama based on the UK's controversial joint enterprise law. Contains very strong language and some violent scenes.
